summary: This bill, "Correcting Guam’s History in the PACT Act," aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code to expand eligibility for a presumption of service connection for diseases related to herbicide exposure for veterans who served in Guam. Specifically, it expands the timeframe of potential exposure and clarifies geographical locations where exposure could have occurred, including territorial waters. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives by Mr. Moylan and co-sponsored by several other representatives and was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
